page.title: 11RIVER,ROAD AND RAIL,BRIDGEND
page.content: The river Ogmore rises above Nantymoel and flows to Ogmore by Sea, joined by the tributaries Garw and Llynfi. People fish for trout sewin and salmon but the water is sometimes polluted. The river has flooded the town, so in 1984 the Welsh Water Authority widened and deepened it. The banks where sand martins used to nest are now concrete. In 1982 the M4 motorway link between London and West Wales was completed. Rapide coaches travel between London and Bridgend in under 3 hours. Bridgend bus station, the first in S. Wales was opened in 1922. The railway was designed and built in 1830 by Brunel. In 1960 B.R. closed the valley lines. The intercity diesel London to Fishguard travels at 125 mph and was introduced in 1976.
